SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

PIONEER DIETS: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN FAMILIES EAT?

Instructions: Please answer as many of these questions as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, University of Saskatchewan, where it will be preserved as part of the permanent records of our province.

Name: Mrs. Ethel Pearl Jones
Address: 186 Jones, Ethel Pearl (Mrs. Frank)
Birthplace: Laramie, Wyoming

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1906
Where did you set up housekeeping? Laramie, Wyoming
Where had you been living before that? Laramie, Wyoming
For how many people did you prepare meals? 4
How far was it to your nearest store? 10 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? Once a week
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Coffee and flour

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Graham's
In what quantities did you buy it? 50 lbs
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $0.75
How much did you use graham flour?
Whole wheat flour? Yes
Was flour milled locally? Yes
How far away? 10 miles
What year? 1946
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? $0.60
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal? Yes
Other? Bacon & cheese
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? No
How did you grind it? With a hand flouring mill

Potatoes, gravy, cornbread, fried chicken, butter, tea.

Much better during harvest season.

Always had our own garden, plenty of good fresh food.

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

My parents were in need of food when always looked ahead to see what a supply of food was available, always paid their debts as soon as they had a bit too often. We were supplied with debts, so we purchased our living and mother did the sewing and mending.

Our need for new furnished matters was packed after we bought our own furniture. I can only say that little for our welfare was needed by our world and social life only my really suffered but knew they would be understood by young people today had their associations in hundreds of years.

No.

My parents were much discontent from 1914-1916

Always looked ahead to see what a supply of food was available, always paid their debts as soon as they had a bit too after it was applied to debts, so we produced our own living and mother did the sewing and mending

When needed the very smallest mites was packed

Afterward the very smallest corn was dry from only rain

Lather for us was hard to come by, but we could only really afford half-burned wood and saved by only buying fresh of today they are careless about young people of today they are careless about
20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

Meals were much the same only but not fixed up as much or made as dainty.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homegrown and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible.)

Since the early forties after the depression was over the homesteading twenties ended.
